page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {Hoyland Lowe Stand}is on land at a height of six hundred feet.Hoyland Lowe Stand is to the west of the township of Hoyland.In 1924,the stand and the land in the immediate vicinity was purchased by the Dearne Valley Water Board.For many years the Stand had been occupied as a dwelling house. Hoyland Low Stand came into being when cairns and columns were built.The accepted theory is that the Stand was erected about the year{1720,}at a time when surrounding countryside was given ever to{hunting,}that it served as a huntsman's box and as a observation point .We estimated the height of Lowe Stand to be 20 metres high and a girth of 14 metres.When we visited the building it was in a very bad state of repair.From Lowe Stand we could see all around the county of South Yorkshire.
